column4: I get "failed to loaded x server" at startup. Whats the command to restore a previous xorg.conf ?
just remove the current xorg.conf (sudo rm <etc>), and my the backup in its place. (sudo mv <etc>)
where do i get the backup from? I didnt back it up b4 I messed with it
that was a bad desicion ;) anyway, sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg ubuntu-desktop
please repeat, I closed the window...
sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg ubuntu-desktop
thanks
I still get error when typing startx: no screens found
I did apt-get install xserver-xorg ubuntu-desktop, but X wont start
then your xorg.conf is not set up properly. as a quick fix, revert to vesa driver
could alsobe you dont have the proper driver installed
well, it worked just fine before I tried to install my new mouse....
I tried to change xorg.conf to install the new cordless mouse
as i said, try reverting to vesa, and then get your drivers set up properly
I tried to select VESA manually, but still same result...
does the screen section of xorg.conf look ok?
I did select vesa with dpkg-reconfigure
I havent change the screensection of xorg.conf at all. And it worked ok 2 hours ago
you have, as you ran dpkg-reconfigure...
ok, anything special I should look for in xorg.conf then?
kitche: That game is this game: http://appdb.winehq.org/appview.php?iVersionId=5252
okay... but wineHQ's hp sais it works fine...
okay, thanks for your information
